item.title: Mock fs with vitest and memfs
item.description: I’ve been using vitest for testing node code lately, and I often want to set up a fake file system. I’d been using mockFS for this, which is no longer maintained. Fortunately memfs is a drop-in alternative — if you know this secret: You’ve got to add a mock fs call. import { vol, fs } from "memfs"; import { vi, describe, test, expect, beforeEach, afterEach } from "vitest"; // Mock fs everywhere else with the memfs version.

item.title: find-which-npm-dependency-has-dependency
item.description: Wow, a lifesaver command right here: npm ls TROUBLESOME_PACKAGE This will output a tree showing all of the node packages in your local project that depend on TROUBLESOME_PACKAGE. Dear lord have I needed this so many times.
